wikipedia_page.main: Caroline Mary Series  (born 24 March 1951) is an English mathematician known for her work in hyperbolic geometry, Kleinian groups and dynamical systems.

response: * Caroline Series (born 1951), English mathematician, daughter of George Series

* David Mumford, Caroline Series, and David Wright, Indra's Pearls: The Vision of Felix Klein, (2002) Cambridge University Press . (Provides an excellent exposition of theory and results, richly illustrated with diagrams.)

Lawrence G. Brown, Paul Chernoff, Edward G. Effros, Calvin Moore, Richard Palais, Caroline Series, John Wermer and Robert Zimmer have been doctoral students of Mackey. Andrew Gleason had no PhD, but considered Mackey to be his advisor.
* David Mumford, Caroline Series, David Wright: Indra's Pearls: The Vision of Felix Klein, Cambridge University Press, 2002,
